original_title: Brooklyn: Portland Avenue N. - Myrtle Avenue
text:
North Portland Avenue, north from Myrtle Avenue. Note the two W. P. A. office shanties.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: October 12, 1940
View 2, 3: September 6, 1939

View 1 is north from a point just above Myrtle Avenue, running across Auburn Place and showing the new Cumberland Hospital on the left. View 3 is north from Auburn Place, it (and view 1) showing looking to east side of the street.
note: All the buildings (except the hospital) were later demolished to make way for the proposed Fort Greene Houses.

original_title: Brooklyn: Portland Avenue N. - Myrtle Avenue
text:
North Portland Avenue, north from Myrtle Avenue. Note the two W. P. A. office shanties.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: October 12, 1940
View 2, 3: September 6, 1939

View 1 is north from a point just above Myrtle Avenue, running across Auburn Place and showing the new Cumberland Hospital on the left. View 3 is north from Auburn Place, it (and view 1) showing looking to east side of the street.
note: All the buildings (except the hospital) were later demolished to make way for the proposed Fort Greene Houses.

289 to 299 Myrtle Avenue, north side, east from North Elliott Place to Portland Avenue, showing all the buildings on the block as seen in two separate photographs. View 1 shows Nos. 289 to 293--five-story buildings of which the tall and narrow one is a fire house of the New York City Fire Department. View 2 shows Nos. 294 to 299--a row of frame dwellings extending to Portland Avenue. This block of buildings were later torn down and Fort Greene Houses, a New York City Housing Authority project, erected on their site.

October, 1940
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

289 to 299 Myrtle Avenue, north side, east from North Elliott Place to Portland Avenue, showing all the buildings on the block as seen in two separate photographs. View 1 shows Nos. 289 to 293--five-story buildings of which the tall and narrow one is a fire house of the New York City Fire Department. View 2 shows Nos. 294 to 299--a row of frame dwellings extending to Portland Avenue. This block of buildings were later torn down and Fort Greene Houses, a New York City Housing Authority project, erected on their site.

October, 1940
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

Myrtle Avenue (El, thereon), west from North Portland Avenue to Leo Place, showing extensive demolition for the erection of Fort Greene Houses. The view is from -ort Greene Park. In the background is St. Edwards Roman Catholic Church.

View 2 is across the same area, from Ashland Place. View 3 is south from North Portland and Park Avenues toward Myrtle Avenue.

P. L. Sperr

April 11, 1941
Views 1-3
